Question
========

An experiment examines the effect of a diet product on body weight. To this end, one of 20 twins is randomly placed in the the treatment group and one in the control group. The treatment group receives the diet product for two months, while the control group receives a placebo. After two months everyone's weight is measured. The most appropriate test to test whether the diet product effect on body weight in this trial design is the

Answerlist
----------

* F-test for equality of variances.
* T-test for two independent samples
* Paired T-test
* CRD-ANOVA

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* F-key for equality of variances: Incorrect
* T-test for two independent samples: Incorrect
* Paired T-test: Correct
* CRD-ANOVA: Incorrect
